summary.long: 2 Thessalonians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Paul and Silvanus and Timothy,
To the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We ought always to give thanks to God for you, brethren, as is only fitting, because your faith is greatly enlarged, and the love of each one of you toward one another grows ever greater;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, we ourselves speak proudly of you among the churches of God for your perseverance and faith in the midst of all your persecutions and afflictions which you endure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is a plain indication of God’s righteous judgment so that you will be considered worthy of the kingdom of God, for which indeed you are suffering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For after all it is only just for God to repay with affliction those who afflict you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to give relief to you who are afflicted and to us as well when the Lord Jesus will be revealed from heaven with His mighty angels in flaming fire,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: dealing out retribution to those who do not know God and to those who do not obey the gospel of our Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These will pay the penalty of eternal destruction, away from the presence of the Lord and from the glory of His power,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when He comes to be glorified in His saints on that day, and to be marveled at among all who have believed—for our testimony to you was believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To this end also we pray for you always, that our God will count you worthy of your calling, and fulfill every desire for goodness and the work of faith with power,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the name of our Lord Jesus will be glorified in you, and you in Him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we request you, brethren, with regard to the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our gathering together to Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you not be quickly shaken from your composure or be disturbed either by a spirit or a message or a letter as if from us, to the effect that the day of the Lord has come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no one in any way deceive you, for it will not come unless the apostasy comes first, and the man of lawlessness is revealed, the son of destruction,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who opposes and exalts himself above every so-called god or object of worship, so that he takes his seat in the temple of God, displaying himself as being God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not remember that while I was still with you, I was telling you these things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you know what restrains him now, so that in his time he will be revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the mystery of lawlessness is already at work; only he who now restrains will do so until he is taken out of the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then that lawless one will be revealed whom the Lord will slay with the breath of His mouth and bring to an end by the appearance of His coming;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that is, the one whose coming is in accord with the activity of Satan, with all power and signs and false wonders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with all the deception of wickedness for those who perish, because they did not receive the love of the truth so as to be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason God will send upon them a deluding influence so that they will believe what is false,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order that they all may be judged who did not believe the truth, but took pleasure in wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we should always give thanks to God for you, brethren beloved by the Lord, because God has chosen you from the beginning for salvation through sanctification by the Spirit and faith in the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was for this He called you through our gospel, that you may gain the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, brethren, stand firm and hold to the traditions which you were taught, whether by word of mouth or by letter from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may our Lord Jesus Christ Himself and God our Father, who has loved us and given us eternal comfort and good hope by grace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: comfort and strengthen your hearts in every good work and word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, brethren, pray for us that the word of the Lord will spread rapidly and be glorified, just as it did also with you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that we will be rescued from perverse and evil men; for not all have faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord is faithful, and He will strengthen and protect you from the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have confidence in the Lord concerning you, that you are doing and will continue to do what we command.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God and into the steadfastness of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we command you, brethren, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you keep away from every brother who leads an unruly life and not according to the tradition which you received from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you yourselves know how you ought to follow our example, because we did not act in an undisciplined manner among you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor did we eat anyone’s bread without paying for it, but with labor and hardship we kept working night and day so that we would not be a burden to any of you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not because we do not have the right to this, but in order to offer ourselves as a model for you, so that you would follow our example.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even when we were with you, we used to give you this order: if anyone is not willing to work, then he is not to eat, either.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we hear that some among you are leading an undisciplined life, doing no work at all, but acting like busybodies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now such persons we command and exhort in the Lord Jesus Christ to work in quiet fashion and eat their own bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, brethren, do not grow weary of doing good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone does not obey our instruction in this letter, take special note of that person and do not associate with him, so that he will be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet do not regard him as an enemy, but admonish him as a brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may the Lord of peace Himself continually grant you peace in every circumstance. The Lord be with you all!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Paul, write this greeting with my own hand, and this is a distinguishing mark in every letter; this is the way I write.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator
